title: I have too many conceptual questions on electrostatics. Basically I am very confused about minute things not explained in textbook. Is anyone willing to answer all my questions (If so please let me know)? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, you can ask. I will try to answer as much as I can. Good books on electrostatics are Panofsky and Phillips, Reitz Milford & christy, Berkeley Physics Course, Greiner, Griffiths.

Thanks for A2A. Why don't you take out some time to google each term that you find confusing? Google will get you to some interesting animation sites even for some electrostatic topics. Some YouTube videos lucidly explain terms, ideas, mechanisms. I don't think if you do this exercise, you will still remain with any residual doubts. You can switch to Griffiths’ for your actual study. Griffiths’ style is conversational and fresh. Good luck 😀👍
